tweets.text:
There is currently 1 flood warning and 5 flood alerts in force for parts of #Cumbria and #Lancashire. 

Check the latest online üëâ https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

Make sure you're prepared and up to date with the current situation. 

#prepareactsurvive #floodaware

"Rivers of Shame," today's @thetimes editorial.

Curious as to why @10DowningStreet are putting up with all of this. They must have realised by now that they've got a major liability on the hands and it's called the @EnvAgency. 

 https://t.co/SAVei8xunt

We need to make space for üíßwaterüíß. Our Living Floodplains projects will restore these vital wetlands to act as a natural sponge. 

Find out more about our Living Floodplains project: https://t.co/woeiKHq7hJ 

#LetNaturehelp #floods #RiverTrent @EnvAgencyMids @HighwaysEngland https://t.co/FsHaL0Qz0D

Fairford Sewage Works deals a crippling blow to the Cotswolds limestone River Coln yesterday. No evidence of pollution or decline says the @EnvAgency as it dies before our eyes @KenGoodwinITV https://t.co/Bs7fI3JISi

@ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV According to last year's data, in 2019 @thameswater spent 2,207 hours, the equivalent of 92 whole days, dumping sewage into the River Coln from the Fairford sewage plant.

"Exceptional circumstance"? https://t.co/trky5H39u8

The Gaywood River  Once provided Kings Lynn with its drinking water at Kettle Mills where iron buckets pulled up the crystal clear water Bawsey ruins site of a Time Team dig 1990‚Äôs @N_Rivers_Trust @jamesowild @EnvAgency @ChalkStreamMon @Feargal_Sharkey @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/mfZSNLvp2x

tweets.text:
Heavy rain is expected in Yorkshire over the weekend. Our teams are working hard to check our flood defences. 

Pictured are flood defences they have strengthened in Todmorden #Calderdale. #PrepareActSurvive 
https://t.co/HNBU0rgQzk https://t.co/PYpv46pwBX

Last chance to register for the #NORA3 conference taking place online AM 4th & 5th Nov. https://t.co/r9wD7ufoVo. Excited to be launching @LIFEprogramme and @EnvAgency supported @NORA_Europe and @NativeOysterNet collaborative efforts. Join us for marine #OceanOptimism. Please RT.

Last chance to register for the #NORA3 conference taking place online AM 4th & 5th Nov. https://t.co/r9wD7ufoVo. Excited to be launching @LIFEprogramme and @EnvAgency supported @NORA_Europe and @NativeOysterNet collaborative efforts. Join us for marine #OceanOptimism. Please RT.

This October half term do your bit to keep our bathing waters safe for all to enjoy! üåä 
Bag up your dog poo and put it in the bin. #BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/q4WSmx95qJ

@WillO61152674 @thetimes @10DowningStreet @EnvAgency The water companies tired to argue that they weren't covered by the Environmental Information Regulations but thanks to @AnglingTrust (Fish Legal), who took them to the High Court, that provided not to be the case. Example.

https://t.co/M8FUcms2kl

Along with the @EnvAgencySE we are appealing to people to stop dumping objects in the River Ouse following a clear up by specialist contractors between Cliff Bridge and Willey‚Äôs Bridge in #Lewes earlier this month
https://t.co/DaIpG4Eidu https://t.co/j1K1OtL3uV
@Feargal_Sharkey @thetimes @10DowningStreet @EnvAgency I think Cameron‚Äôs lot exempted English Water Authorities from FOI
This is a sadly a regular occurrence, dumping in our lovely river, sometimes local volunteers clear it up but this time thanks goes to our team at @LewesDC and @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/tMepjlRg4D
